data.title: 29 Superfortress Then and Now eGroups mailing list
data.meta_description: Page to aid you in joing our B-29 mailing lisrt on the eGroups site.  This mail list is part of the B-29 Superfotress Then and Now . . a website dedicated to the amazing B-29 and the men and women who flew and built them. The largest site on the net with personal stories, photos, nose art, training films and more.
data.text:
I have created a B-29 mailing list that is now hosted by Yahoo Groups to help widen our network of B-29 veterans, their families and anyone who admires the B-29. At present we have over 300 members which include B-29 veterans, their descendants and others who simply enjoy this magnificent flying machine.

Yahoo Groups is a free and easy email group. You can go to their site to check out their entire list of mail groups here. Check out eGroups by clicking on What is eGroups and Take the Tour - This will give you an overview of what an email mailing list is.

Subscribe:

If you would like to join our mailing list:

First, click here to go to our community's front page.

Next you'll see a page with three columns: a left menu column, a center "Description" column, and a right column titled "Join Now!" Click on "Subscribe" in the right column.

Now click the link that says, "New Member? Click here to register for FREE!" Then fill out the info and pick a password. Follow the instructions, such as submitting the verification code that Yahoo will send you by e-mail, and you'll be all set as a new B-29 community member!

Changing Your Status:

Once you've subscribed you're now a member of our community. Now you can change your settings: how you receive e-mail, your profile, etc.

First, go to the front page here.

Now the third column on the right is labeled "Membership." Click on "Delivery Options."

Now you can change how you receive messages:

Individual emails - getting the messages one at a time as they come in.

Daily digest - getting all the messages combines into one digest (you will not receive any attachments of files or photos in this method)

No Mail - which means you are a member but don't want e-mail; you'll read the messages on the web site. Use this option when going on vacation or if you do NOT want email arriving at your inbox on your home PC.

Under "HTML Email" are these options:

HTML You'll receive email with colors and graphics.

Plain text You'll get mostly text in the body of the e-mails.

Once you make your changes, click on the "Save Changes" button, and you're set!
